text: [music playing]
TOMEKA JONES: This is Thailand.

I'm Tomeka Jones, here in
the capital city, Bangkok.

One of the most visited
cities in the world,

it's an amazing
place to see some

of the temples that reflect
Thailand's culture and history.
[chanting]

TOMEKA JONES: Take a moment to
make 108 wishes in one place

at one time at the famous
Wat Pho, the temple
of the reclining Buddha.

We're on Chao Phraya
River, ready to explore
the exquisite sights of Bangkok.

NIKOLAUS PRIESNITZ: You
have to on the river.

No question, because you see the
sights in a very different way.
See the temples.
See the culture.
Get to know all that.
The religion is fantastic.

And on top of it all
are the proud people

of Thailand that really
understand on how
to deliver Thai hospitality.

TOMEKA JONES: Thann Sanctuary
Spa promises a luxurious
and even blissful experience.

THITIPAT SUPAPATRANONT: I think
it's starting from the quality
of our service.
It including Thai hospitality.

Thai people, in
general, we really

welcome the guests who
come to our business

and really service
people with our heart.

Secondly, massage quality
is part of history
of Thailand for long time.

TOMEKA JONES: A Thai massage
is deep, rhythmic acupressure.

THITIPAT SUPAPATRANONT: Lots of
pulling, I think, is painful.

It actually is if
you have really

sore muscle, because it goes
deep into your stiff muscle.

But after the massage,
you feel so light.

TOMEKA JONES: For
even more relaxation,

the spa provides specialty
rooms with additional services.

And I just had to
give them a try.

THITIPAT SUPAPATRANONT:
Our facility also include
what we call wellness zone.

The first one is
the oxygen room.

The second room we
call the salt cave.

TOMEKA JONES: Thann really lives
up to its name as a sanctuary
for rejuvenation.

Now, this colonial
style mansion is

where you can create
and enjoy some
of Bangkok's best Thai dishes.

NOOROR SOMANY STEPPE:
Welcome comes to the Blue
Elephant cooking class.

TOMEKA JONES: Arrange
an intimate cooking

class with Blue Elephant's world
renowned master chef, Nooror.

NOOROR SOMANY
STEPPE: Or we offer
the guests different recipe.

We have soup, we have
starter, we have curry,
and we have wok stir fry.

TOMEKA JONES: Today's dish is
crab curry with beetle leaves.

NOOROR SOMANY STEPPE:
Lemon grass, turmeric.

TOMEKA JONES: Chef Nooror
uses several fresh ingredients
during her demonstration.

Next, a mortar and pestle
to grind it all nicely.

Guests are invited
to assist her, then

move on to their own
personal cooking station.
I even jumped in.
Now, for the taste test.

And to my surprise, the
crab curry I prepared
turned out amazing.
So good.

Now, for breathtaking
views of Bangkok's skyline,

visit the iconic
tower club at Lebua.

Overlooking the
Chao Phraya River,

this all suite hotel takes
a luxury to a new level.

DEEPAK OHRI: It's so
emotional at Lebua.

Sometimes people get confused
whether it's about the view,

whether it's about the building,
whether it's about the people,

whether it's about service,
or whether it's a products.

So it's a combination of all
that that makes it beyond dream

and which is a
reality only at Lebua.

TOMEKA JONES: When you arrive,
you are greeted by Lebua's
impeccable hospitality team.

After settling in,
enjoy the atmosphere

during high tea at the
private tower club lounge.

Then watch the sunset
inside or outside the dome.

DEEPAK OHRI: It houses three of
the most stylish bar, two very

stylish restaurants,
and one very funky place

where you can sit
and enjoy cigars.

TOMEKA JONES: A popular
attraction at Lebua?

The stunning sky bar,
one of the highest
rooftop bars in the world.

Well, Bangkok has definitely
been exciting and adventurous.

Now, I'm going enjoy a
little bit of the night life,
as well as this gorgeous view.

Until the next time,
I'm Tomeka Jones.
